ground_truth: He passes her the joint, then takes the Digicam and focuses it on her. We see her image on the TV as he videotapes. Jane looks into the camera, a loopy, stoned grin on her face. They laugh. She lays back on the bed. Her mind wanders for a beat. Jane looks at him and sits up. She smiles dreamily at him. He turns the Digicam off, and the TV screen goes blue. He lowers the camera and looks at her intently. He puts the Digicam down and joins Jane on the bed. A long moment where neither of them speaks. He caresses her hair, gazing into her eyes. We're flying above Robin Hood Trail. We see the Burnham's house below us as we approach it steadily. We're almost on top of the Burnham house now, as Lester, wearing sweatpants and running shoes, bursts out of the front door and dashes up the driveway. We're now at street level, as Lester runs toward us. He's in excellent shape; even his posture has changed, and he moves with the confident, easy swagger of an athlete. The endorphins have kicked in, and Lester grins, reveling in the sheer physical pleasure of his body. The blender grinds as Lester, still in his sweatpants, makes himself a high-protein shake. Jane watches him blankly from the kitchen table. Carolyn enters. Lester leans against the counter, drinking his shake directly from the blender pitcher, eyeing her. He's got a newfound sexual energy that makes her uncomfortable, and he knows it. Carolyn quickly rinses off her coffee cup, avoiding his eyes, and starts out. Jane looks at Lester to see how he reacts. And she's gone. Jane continues staring at her father. Finally, he glances over at her. Jane is stunned. She quickly rises, trying to get out of the kitchen before she starts crying. Angle on Lester, and the immediate regret in his eyes. We're outside Ricky's room, moving slowly toward the open door, through which we can see Ricky, standing at his bureau mirror, combing his hair. The scars on his face are almost gone now. A reverse angle reveals the Colonel standing outside the door looking in, watching Ricky with great tenderness. Then Ricky looks up at him, and the Colonel is suddenly self-conscious. Ricky emerges from the house, followed by the Colonel, who watches his son as he heads toward the Burnham house. Carolyn waves from the Mercedes, flashing an insincere smile. Jane leans forward from the passenger seat and glares at us. As Ricky starts to get in the car, Lester emerges from the house in his sweatpants. The Colonel watches, at first baffled, then impatient. Close on the Colonel's face: he looks confused.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He hands her the reefer, then takes the Digicam and aims it at her. We observe her likeness on the TV as he records. Jane gazes into the camera, a silly, intoxicated smile on her visage. They chuckle. She reclines on the bed. Her mind drifts for a moment. Jane glances at him and rises up. She beams dreamily at him. He switches the Digicam off, and the TV monitor turns azure. He lowers the camera and gazes at her keenly. He places the Digicam down and joins Jane on the bed. A long moment where neither of them speaks. He strokes her tresses, staring into her eyes. We're hovering above Robin Hood Trail. We observe the Burnham's residence beneath us as we near it steadily. We're almost above the Burnham house now, as Lester, clad in sweatpants and running sneakers, erupts out of the front entrance and sprints up the driveway. We're now at street level, as Lester dashes toward us. He's in superb condition; even his stance has altered, and he moves with the assured, easy stride of an athlete. The endorphins have surged, and Lester smiles, savoring the pure corporeal delight of his physique. The blender pulverizes as Lester, still in his sweatpants, prepares himself a high-protein smoothie. Jane observes him blankly from the kitchen table. Carolyn enters. Lester leans against the counter, drinking his smoothie directly from the blender pitcher, observing her. He's got a newfound sexual vigor that makes her uneasy, and he knows it. Carolyn quickly rinses off her coffee mug, evading his eyes, and starts out. Jane glances at Lester to see how he responds. And she's gone. Jane continues staring at her father. Finally, he looks over at her. Jane is astonished. She quickly rises, attempting to exit the kitchen before she starts weeping. Angle on Lester, and the instant regret in his eyes. We're outside Ricky's room, moving slowly toward the open entrance, through which we can see Ricky, standing at his bureau mirror, combing his hair. The scars on his face are nearly vanished now. A reverse angle reveals the Colonel standing outside the entrance looking in, observing Ricky with great affection. Then Ricky looks up at him, and the Colonel is suddenly self-conscious. Ricky exits the house, followed by the Colonel, who observes his son as he heads toward the Burnham house. Carolyn waves from the Mercedes, flashing a hollow smile. Jane leans forward from the passenger seat and glares at us. As Ricky starts to get in the car, Lester emerges from the house in his sweatpants. The Colonel observes, at first perplexed, then impatient. Close on the Colonel's face: he looks bewildered.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He hands her the joint and focuses the Digicam on her. Her image appears on the TV as he films. Jane grins dreamily. They laugh, and she reclines on the bed. Jane looks at him and sits up, smiling dreamily. He turns off the Digicam, making the TV screen go blue, and joins Jane on the bed. A silent moment follows. He caresses her hair, gazing into her eyes. We fly over Robin Hood Trail, approaching the Burnham house. Lester, in sweatpants and running shoes, bursts out the front door and runs up the driveway. At street level, Lester runs confidently, showing athletic prowess and reveling in physical pleasure. The blender whirs as he makes a high-protein shake. Jane watches blankly from the kitchen as Carolyn enters. Lester drinks from the blender pitcher, exuding a surprising sexual energy that unsettles Carolyn. She quickly leaves without looking at him. Jane observes Lester, then rises quickly to leave, nearly in tears. Lester's face shows immediate regret. Outside Ricky's room, we see Ricky at the mirror, almost scar-free, being watched tenderly by the Colonel. Ricky notices him, causing the Colonel to become self-conscious. Ricky leaves, followed by the Colonel, who watches him head to the Burnham house. Carolyn waves from the Mercedes with a fake smile. Jane glares from the passenger seat. As Ricky approaches the car, Lester appears in his sweatpants. The Colonel watches, transitioning from confusion to impatience. Close on the Colonel's confused face.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He passes her the joint and films her with the Digicam, her image appearing on the TV. Jane grins, stoned, and laughs as she lies back. She sits up, smiling dreamily at him. He turns off the camera, leaving the TV screen blue, and joins her on the bed, where they share a silent, tender moment. He caresses her hair, gazing into her eyes. We're above Robin Hood Trail, approaching the Burnham's house. Lester, in sweatpants and running shoes, bursts out and runs confidently, reveling in physical pleasure. He makes a high-protein shake, eyeing Carolyn with new sexual energy. She avoids him, rinsing her cup. Jane watches, stunned, and leaves before crying. Lester feels immediate regret. Outside Ricky's room, we see him at the mirror, his scars nearly gone. The Colonel watches him tenderly, becoming self-conscious when Ricky notices. Ricky leaves the house, with the Colonel watching as he heads toward the Burnham house. Carolyn waves insincerely from the Mercedes. Jane glares from the passenger seat. As Ricky gets in the car, Lester appears, confusing the Colonel, who looks baffled.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
He carefully passes her the joint with a casual gesture, then picks up the Digicam and directs its focus toward her. As he begins to videotape, her image appears on the TV screen, creating a live display. Jane, with a loopy, stoned grin on her face, gazes into the camera lens. They both burst into laughter, caught in the moment. She reclines back on the bed, allowing her mind to wander and drift for a brief moment. Jane turns her gaze toward him, sits up, and offers him a dreamy, almost enchanted smile. He decides to turn the Digicam off, and instantly, the TV screen transitions to a blank blue. Lowering the camera, he looks at her with a deep, intent expression. He gently sets the Digicam aside and moves to join Jane on the bed. There is a lingering moment where neither of them utters a word. He tenderly runs his fingers through her hair, gazing deeply into her eyes. 

We are then transported to the sky, flying above Robin Hood Trail. The familiar image of the Burnham's house comes into view beneath us, as we progress steadily in its direction. We draw nearer to the Burnham residence, as Lester, clad in sweatpants and running shoes, energetically bursts out of the front door and sprints up the driveway. Transitioning to street level, Lester runs toward us with vigor. His fitness level is apparent; his posture is straighter and more confident, embodying the relaxed, easy swagger of an accomplished athlete. The endorphins rush through him, and he grins exuberantly, lost in the pure physical delight of his own body. The sound of the blender grinding fills the air as Lester, still wearing his sweatpants, prepares a high-protein shake for himself. Jane sits at the kitchen table, watching him blankly. Carolyn enters the room. Lester casually leans against the counter, sipping his shake straight from the blender pitcher, all the while eyeing her with intent. His newfound, almost palpable sexual energy makes her uneasy, and he is fully aware of it. Carolyn quickly rinses her coffee cup under the tap, carefully avoiding eye contact, and starts to leave the room. Jane watches Lester, observing his reaction closely. Carolyn leaves, and Jane continues to stare at her father. Eventually, Lester glances over at her. Jane is taken aback, stunned by what she sees. Hastily, she rises, eager to leave the kitchen before tears begin to flow. 

We cut to a view outside Ricky's room, slowly moving toward the open door. Through it, we can see Ricky standing at his bureau mirror, diligently combing his hair. The scars that marred his face are nearly invisible now. In a reverse angle, the Colonel is seen standing just outside the door, peering in, watching Ricky with profound tenderness. Ricky lifts his gaze, meeting the Colonel's eyes, making the older man suddenly self-conscious. Ricky steps outside, followed closely by the Colonel, who watches his son as he makes his way toward the Burnham house. Carolyn waves from the driver's seat of the Mercedes, her smile insincere. From the passenger seat, Jane leans forward, her expression intense as she glares in our direction. As Ricky moves to get into the car, Lester emerges from the house still dressed in his sweatpants. The Colonel observes, initially at a loss for what is happening, before his expression shifts to one of impatience. The focus tightens on the Colonel's face, revealing a look of confusion.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
He carefully and deliberately passes her the joint with a nonchalant and casual gesture, before turning his attention to the Digicam, which he picks up with deliberate intent. He then directs its focus toward her, preparing to capture her image through the lens. As he begins to videotape, her image magically appears on the TV screen, creating a vivid and enchanting live display for them to watch. Jane, sporting a loopy and stoned grin on her face, gazes deeply into the camera lens. They both suddenly burst into laughter, completely caught up in the spontaneous joy of the moment. She then reclines back on the comfortable bed, allowing her mind to wander and drift away for a brief moment of introspection. Jane slowly turns her gaze toward him, sits up, and offers him a dreamy, almost enchanted smile that seems to hold a world of unspoken meaning. In response, he decides to turn the Digicam off, and instantly, the vibrant TV screen transitions to a blank blue. Lowering the camera thoughtfully, he looks at her with a deep, intent expression that conveys his feelings. He gently sets the Digicam aside and moves to join Jane on the bed, closing the distance between them. There is a lingering, tender moment where neither of them utters a single word. He tenderly runs his fingers through her hair, gazing deeply into her eyes with affection.

We are then transported to a sweeping view of the sky, flying high above the famous Robin Hood Trail. The familiar image of the Burnham's house comes into view beneath us, as we progress steadily and purposely in its direction. We draw nearer to the Burnham residence, just as Lester, clad in comfortable sweatpants and sturdy running shoes, energetically bursts out of the front door and sprints up the driveway with enthusiasm. Transitioning smoothly to street level, Lester approaches us with vigor. His fitness level is apparent; his posture is straighter and more confident, embodying the relaxed, easy swagger of an accomplished athlete in peak condition. The endorphins rush through his body, and he grins exuberantly, completely lost in the pure physical delight of his own body and movement. The sound of the blender grinding fills the air as Lester, still comfortably wearing his sweatpants, prepares a nutritious high-protein shake for himself. Jane sits at the kitchen table, watching him with a blank, distant expression. Carolyn enters the room, bringing a different energy. Lester casually leans against the counter, sipping his shake straight from the blender pitcher, all the while eyeing her with intent and intensity. His newfound, almost palpable sexual energy makes her uneasy, and he is fully aware of the effect he has on her. Carolyn quickly rinses her coffee cup under the tap, carefully avoiding making eye contact with Lester, and starts to leave the room. Jane continues to watch Lester, closely observing his reaction and demeanor. Carolyn leaves, and Jane continues to stare at her father, scrutinizing him. Eventually, Lester glances over at her. Jane is taken aback, stunned by the transformation she sees. Hastily, she rises, eager to leave the kitchen before tears begin to flow uncontrollably.

We cut to an evocative view outside Ricky's room, slowly moving toward the open door, inviting us to peek inside. Through it, we can see Ricky standing at his bureau mirror, diligently and meticulously combing his hair. The scars that once marred his face are now nearly invisible, almost erased. In a reverse angle, the Colonel is seen standing just outside the door, peering in, watching his son with profound tenderness and affection. Ricky lifts his gaze, meeting the Colonel's eyes, which makes the older man suddenly self-conscious and a bit embarrassed. Ricky steps outside, followed closely by the Colonel, who watches his son with pride as he makes his way toward the Burnham house. Carolyn waves from the driver's seat of the sleek Mercedes, her smile insincere and forced. From the passenger seat, Jane leans forward, her expression intense as she glares in our direction with determination. As Ricky moves to get into the car, Lester emerges from the house still dressed in his comfortable sweatpants. The Colonel observes the unfolding scene, initially at a loss for what is happening, before his expression shifts to one of visible impatience. The focus tightens on the Colonel's face, revealing a look of confusion and uncertainty.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He passes her the joint, fingers brushing against hers as he transfers it into her grasp, and then he smoothly takes hold of the Digicam, lifting it with practiced ease. He carefully adjusts the lens, bringing it into focus on her, aligning the camera's viewfinder to perfectly capture her image. As this unfolds, her image flickers onto the TV screen, becoming a live, jittery broadcast of her presence as he begins to videotape. She gazes directly into the camera, her eyes glazed with a loopy, stoned grin spreading lazily across her face, an expression of carefree euphoria. Their shared laughter fills the room, echoing as she leisurely reclines backwards onto the bed, her body sinking into the mattress, and for a transient moment, her mind drifts away. Her gaze returns to him, and she pushes herself back up into a sitting position, a dreamy smile still lingering as she looks at him with a softened expression. His finger presses the button to power off the Digicam, and the TV screen instantly turns a static blue, the previous image replaced by a solid, blank canvas. Lowering the camera, he studies her with an intent gaze, noting the subtle nuances of her expression. With a decisive motion, he sets the Digicam aside and moves towards the bed, settling down beside her, initiating an extended pause where silence envelops them. He reaches out to gently caress her hair, fingers weaving through the strands as he gazes deeply into her eyes, the moment heavy with unspoken words. Transitioning to a new scene, we are lifted high above Robin Hood Trail, gliding smoothly through the air, our perspective widening to reveal the Burnham's house steadily growing larger beneath us as we draw closer. We are almost overhead now, just as Lester, attired in casual sweatpants and running shoes, bursts energetically out the front door, launching himself onto the driveway with determination. Our view shifts to street level as Lester approaches with a focused run, his physical condition evident in the way he carries himself, his posture transformed with a newfound athletic swagger. He is invigorated, his body thrumming with endorphins, and a broad grin stretches across his face, a testament to the sheer enjoyment he derives from his physical exertion. A mechanical whirring noise fills the air as the blender operates, grinding its contents, while Lester, still wearing his sweatpants, concocts a high-protein shake. Seated at the kitchen table, Jane watches him vacantly, her expression unreadable. Carolyn enters the kitchen, and Lester leans casually against the counter, lifting the blender pitcher to his lips as he drinks, his eyes fixated on her with a palpable tension. An unfamiliar sexual energy radiates from Lester, causing Carolyn discomfort, an effect he is acutely aware of. She rinses her coffee cup quickly, avoiding eye contact, and makes her way toward the exit. Jane observes Lester closely, monitoring how he responds to Carolyn's departure. As Carolyn leaves, Jane continues to stare at her father, her gaze unwavering until he finally meets her eyes. Jane, stunned by something unspoken, abruptly stands and hurries out of the kitchen, attempting to escape before tears can surface. The scene shifts again to the outside of Ricky's room, where we progress slowly towards the open door, through which we can see Ricky poised in front of his bureau mirror, methodically combing his hair, the almost healed scars faintly visible on his face. From a different angle, we notice the Colonel standing outside the door, watching Ricky with a tenderness that softens his usually stern demeanor. Just as Ricky's eyes meet the Colonel's in the reflection, the Colonel becomes suddenly aware of his vulnerability. Ricky exits the house, with the Colonel trailing behind, his gaze following his son as he crosses the space towards the Burnham house. Carolyn, seated in a Mercedes, lifts her hand in a wave, a perfunctory smile pasted on her face. Jane, seated in the passenger seat, leans forward and casts a piercing glare outward. As Ricky approaches the car to get inside, Lester emerges from the house once again, clad in his sweatpants. The Colonel observes these events unfold, his initial expression perplexed, gradually shifting to one of impatience. In a close-up, the Colonel's face reflects his confusion with furrowed brows and uncertain eyes.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: He passes her the joint and begins videotaping her with the Digicam, displaying her on the TV screen. Jane, wearing a stoned grin, laughs and reclines on the bed, her mind momentarily drifting before she sits up and smiles at him. Turning off the camera, he joins her on the bed, and they share a quiet, intimate moment as he gently caresses her hair. Transitioning to an aerial view, we see Lester energetically sprinting from the Burnham house, embodying an athlete's confident swagger. His endorphins high, he revels in the physical pleasure while making a high-protein shake in the kitchen. Jane watches him blankly, and upon Carolyn’s entrance, his new sexual energy unnerves her. Carolyn rinses her coffee cup, avoiding eye contact as she exits. Jane observes Lester’s reaction and swiftly leaves to hide her tears, leaving Lester with immediate regret. Outside, the Colonel watches Ricky comb his hair, his scars nearly vanished. The Colonel's tender gaze shifts to self-consciousness when Ricky notices him. Ricky heads to the Burnham house, followed by the Colonel's watchful eyes. In the car, Carolyn's insincere smile contrasts with Jane’s glare from the passenger seat. As Ricky approaches, Lester emerges from his house, causing the Colonel's bafflement to turn into impatience and confusion.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
He passes her the joint, a hand-rolled one indicative of their casual setting, then takes the Digicam, a popular early 2000s compact digital video camera, and focuses it on her. We see her image on the TV screen, probably an older tube television given the era, as he videotapes. Jane looks into the camera, a loopy, stoned grin on her face. They laugh, sharing a moment that seems carefree. She lays back on the bed, which is covered with a vintage quilt, suggesting a nostalgic or eclectic sense of style. Her mind wanders for a beat. Jane looks at him and sits up, the room dimly lit by a single bedside lamp casting soft shadows. She smiles dreamily at him. He turns the Digicam off, and the TV screen goes blue, a common occurrence with older TVs when no input signal is detected. He lowers the camera and looks at her intently, as if searching for unspoken words. He puts the Digicam down and joins Jane on the bed. A long moment where neither of them speaks, the silence filled with the ambient hum of the city outside. He caresses her hair, gazing into her eyes. 

We're flying above Robin Hood Trail, a scenic suburban street lined with mature oaks and maples, known for its picturesque charm. We see the Burnham's house below us, a classic two-story home with a well-manicured lawn, as we approach it steadily. We're almost on top of the Burnham house now, as Lester, wearing sweatpants and running shoes from a popular athletic brand, bursts out of the front door and dashes up the driveway. We're now at street level, as Lester runs toward us. He's in excellent shape; even his posture has changed, and he moves with the confident, easy swagger of an athlete, like someone who has recently embraced a healthier lifestyle. The endorphins have kicked in, and Lester grins, reveling in the sheer physical pleasure of his body. The blender grinds noisily as Lester, still in his sweatpants, makes himself a high-protein shake, a routine part of his new fitness regime. Jane watches him blankly from the kitchen table, where her textbooks and notebooks suggest she's been studying. Carolyn enters, her tailored suit indicating she's ready for a day at the office. Lester leans against the counter, drinking his shake directly from the blender pitcher, eyeing her with a gaze that holds both defiance and invitation. He's got a newfound sexual energy that makes her uncomfortable, and he knows it. Carolyn quickly rinses off her coffee cup, avoiding his eyes, and starts out of the room. Jane looks at Lester to see how he reacts. And she's gone, her heels clicking sharply down the hallway. Jane continues staring at her father, her expression a mixture of curiosity and concern. Finally, he glances over at her. Jane is stunned. She quickly rises, trying to get out of the kitchen before she starts crying, her emotions too raw and close to the surface. Angle on Lester, and the immediate regret in his eyes as he realizes the impact of his actions. 

We're outside Ricky's room, in a quiet suburban neighborhood, moving slowly toward the open door, through which we can see Ricky, standing at his bureau mirror, combing his hair meticulously. The scars on his face, remnants of past struggles, are almost gone now. A reverse angle reveals the Colonel standing outside the door looking in, watching Ricky with great tenderness, a rare show of vulnerability. Then Ricky looks up at him, and the Colonel is suddenly self-conscious, his usual stoic demeanor momentarily broken. Ricky emerges from the house, followed by the Colonel, who watches his son as he heads toward the Burnham house, a short walk they've made many times on lazy afternoons. Carolyn waves from the Mercedes, a sleek luxury sedan that showcases her success, flashing an insincere smile as if on cue. Jane leans forward from the passenger seat and glares at us, her expression one of defiance and silent rebellion. As Ricky starts to get in the car, Lester emerges from the house in his sweatpants, a familiar morning routine. The Colonel watches, at first baffled, then impatient as he tries to understand the dynamics at play. Close on the Colonel's face: he looks confused, his thoughts a jumble of past and present colliding.

A reverse angle reveals the Colonel standing outside the door looking in watching Ricky with great tenderness. Then Ricky looks up at him and the Colonel is suddenly selfconscious. Ricky emerges from the house followed by the Colonel who watches his son as he heads toward the Burnham house. Carolyn waves from the Mercedes flashing an insincere smile. Jane leans forward from the passenger seat and glares at us. As Ricky starts to get in the car Lester emerges from the house in his sweatpants. The Colonel watches at first baffled then impatient. Close on the Colonel's face. he looks confused.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He passes her the joint then takes the Digicam and focuses it on her. We see her image on the TV as he videotapes. Jane looks into the camera a loopy stoned grin on her face. They laugh. She lays back on the bed. Her mind wanders for a beat. Jane looks at him and sits up. She smiles dreamily at him. He turns the Digicam off and the TV screen goes blue. He lowers the camera and looks at her intently. He puts the Digicam down and joins Jane on the bed. A long moment where neither of them speaks. He caresses her hair gazing into her eyes. We are flying above Robin Hood Trail. We see the Burnham's house below us as we approach it steadily. We are almost on top of the Burnham house now as Lester wearing sweatpants and running shoes bursts out of the front door and dashes up the driveway. We are now at street level as Lester runs toward us. He is in excellent shape even his posture has changed and he moves with the confident easy swagger of an athlete. The endorphins have kicked in and Lester grins reveling in the sheer physical pleasure of his body. The blender grinds as Lester still in his sweatpants makes himself a highprotein shake. Jane watches him blankly from the kitchen table. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. Carolyn enters. Lester leans against the counter drinking his shake directly from the blender pitcher eyeing her. He is got a newfound sexual energy that makes her uncomfortable and he knows it. Carolyn quickly rinses off her coffee cup avoiding his eyes and starts out. Jane looks at Lester to see how he reacts. And she is gone. Jane continues staring at her father. Finally he glances over at her. Jane is stunned. She quickly rises trying to get out of the kitchen before she starts crying. Angle on Lester and the immediate regret in his eyes. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She hands him the frisbee, then picks up the clarinet and points it at him. We view his silhouette on the billboard as she sketches. Robert glances into the sketchpad, a goofy, amused smirk crossing his lips. They chuckle. He sprawls out on the hammock. His thoughts drift for a moment. Robert peers at her and stands. He grins whimsically at her. She switches the clarinet off, and the billboard fades to black. She lifts the clarinet and stares at him deeply. She places the clarinet aside and joins Robert on the hammock. A prolonged pause where silence envelops. She strokes his beard, locking eyes with him. We're soaring above Gingerbread Valley. We spot the Anderson's cabin below us as we near it steadily. We're right above the Anderson cabin now, as Carl, clad in overalls and leather boots, storms out of the back alley and gallops down the path. We're now at ground level, as Carl charges our way. He’s in peak condition; even his demeanor has transformed, and he strides with the assured, seamless swagger of a gymnast. The adrenaline has surged, and Carl beams, basking in the sheer kinetic thrill of his movements. The juicer hums as Carl, still in his overalls, prepares a vitamin-rich smoothie. Robert observes him vacantly from the dining counter. Monica arrives. Carl lounges against the stovetop, sipping his smoothie directly from the juicer container, eyeing her. He exudes a newfound daring charisma that makes her uneasy, and he’s aware of it. Monica swiftly rinses her lemonade glass, evading his gaze, and heads out. Robert watches Carl to gauge his reaction. And she departs. Robert continues surveying his brother. Eventually, he glances at him. Robert is taken aback. He quickly stands, attempting to leave the dining room before tears spill. Angle on Carl, and the immediate remorse in his gaze. We're outside Ada's closet, creeping slowly toward the ajar entrance, through which we can see Ada, standing at her dresser mirror, adjusting her earrings. The blemishes on her cheeks have nearly faded now. A reverse angle reveals the Captain lurking by the entrance peering in, observing Ada with immense affection. Then Ada glances up at her, and the Captain becomes instantly bashful. Ada exits the cottage, trailed by the Captain, who watches her child as she heads toward the Anderson cabin. Monica waves from the Volkswagen, displaying a fake grin. Robert inclines forward from the driver seat and glowers at us. As Ada begins to enter the vehicle, Carl exits the cabin in his overalls. The Captain observes, initially bewildered, then restless. Close on the Captain's expression: she appears puzzled.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The scene unfolds with a young couple, passing a joint and laughing, as the boy films the girl with a Digicam, showcasing her stoned grin on TV before joining her on the bed for a tender moment. The narrative shifts to Lester, who bursts out of his house, running with newfound vigor and confidence. Back inside, he makes a high-protein shake, displaying an unsettling sexual energy that disturbs Carolyn, who avoids his gaze. Jane observes the tense interaction between her parents, overwhelmed by her father's transformation, and hastily exits the kitchen. Meanwhile, Ricky is seen grooming himself in front of a mirror, his facial scars nearly healed. His father, the Colonel, watches him with tenderness. Ricky proceeds to the Burnham's house, with the Colonel observing him and becoming confused when Lester, still in his sweatpants, appears outside. Carolyn offers an insincere wave from her car, while Jane glares from the passenger seat.
